Nerangs.ab: ō ī gāh ī ābardān šudan war ō ātaxšgāh ud barsom kardan aṣ̌əm vōhū sē guftan
"He should clean his hands with pādyāb, go to the place of the ābard, facing the ātaxšgāh and the barsom and recite three aṣ̌əm vōhū."

dudīgar bār pad gāh ī ātrawaxšān ān gyāg kū humāiiahe pairi.jaθnō bē ēstišn u-š war andar hamāg sāzišn kunišn aṣ̌əm bē gōwišn dudīgar bār hamāg xūb bē nigerišn u-š ātaxšgāh šustan u-š dast pad pādyāb abāz kardan

"The second time, he has to stand at the place of the ātrawaxš, there where he stands while reciting humāiiahe pairi.jaθnō. He has to face all the implements and recite the ašəm (vohū). He has to look all (implements) carefully and clean the ātaxšgāh. He has to wash his hands again with pādyāb."

Quotations.ab:
NērangVVrS0.2 (Nērang ī āb) [mss. 4000 4010 4020 4025 4063], cf. WiD and Revāyat of Kāma Bohra (MU1, p. I. 577), on the Nērang ī Āb ud Padyāb ceremony:
(Pahl.) dudīgar bār pad gāh ātrawaxšān ān gyāg kū humāiiehe. pairi.jaθnō. bē estišn u-š war andar hamāg sāzišn kunišn ašəm. bē gōwišn
"Secondly, he has to stay at the place of the ātrawaxš, at that place where humāiiehe pairi.jaϑnō (is recited), and facing the whole ritual instruments, he has to recite aṣ̌əm (vohū)."
